## Convert all applicable characters to HTML entities except <, >, and & (when used in an entity).
perl -pe 's/</\xEF\xBF\xBC/g' \ | perl -pe 's/>/\xEF\xBF\xBD/g' \ | perl -pe 's/&(?=([a-zA-Z]+|#[0-9]+|#x[0-9a-fA-F]+);)/\xEF\xBF\xBE/g' \ | php -r 'echo htmlentities( file_get_contents("/dev/stdin"), ENT_NOQUOTES, "UTF-8" );' \ | perl -pe 's/\xEF\xBF\xBC/</g' \ | perl -pe 's/\xEF\xBF\xBD/>/g' \ | perl -pe 's/\xEF\xBF\xBE/&/g'
